name: Carmel Valley Ranch

reviews.text: Fantastic hotel - beautiful location, beautiful rooms, helpful and attentive staff who were not over-bearing. Delicious food as well - my partner said the vegetarian pasta was one of the best vegetarian meals she had ever had - and all prepared using home-grown produce!
reviews.title: Complete tranquility!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights at Carmel Valley Ranch in early October 2012. The resort is very classy and located in a fabulous setting among the mountains. Spectacular views all around. The staff were all friendly and very helpful. Our room (Santa Lucia suite in in the Bluffs area) was spacious, with king bed, sofa, fireplace, huge bathroom and large deck). There was a small refrigerator which we used for snacks, etc. We enjoyed yoga at the River Ranch fitness, pool and tennis center. I played golf one day on site which my wife enjoyed the spa. The golf course is beautiful and very well maintained (although only 6200 yards from the tips). The ate dinner at the main restaurant twice. The food was good, but my steak one night was over-cooked. The offer make your own s'mores each night by the fire pit! Great idea and well used by us.
reviews.title: Wonderful retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You should know that the resort is quite spread out. There are no guest rooms in the main lodge itself, but rather in three pods of rooms. Our room was a 7-10 min walk to the main lodge. We didn't mind this, but if you are expecting to be able to walk downstairs for food, pool, etc., you will be disappointed. We liked the seclusion of the room, but might not be for everyone. There are deer, turkeys and other animals all over the place - almost like a zoo! I saw 11 deer on one golf hole alone. There are some trails around the property that we used extensively. We walked to the River Ranch complex every day - but it takes about 20 mins unless you take some shortcuts across the golf course.
reviews.title: Wonderful Birthday Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are also limited food choices. The main lodge has a restaurant, but no informal coffee shop or anything like that. There is also food at the golf clubhouse and the River Ranch, but limited times and selection. We ordered room service for breakfast twice, and each time they seemed a little surprised we were doing this. The food was fine, although by the time it gets to you, the hot drinks are lukewarm only. We ended up eating off site quite a bit, and snacking in the room quite a bit (fridge was helpful).
reviews.title: Perfect Proposal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the drive down to Big Sur (we ate at Nepenthe - well worth it, but very casual atmosphere). Point Lobos State Park was also fantastic. We also loved the quaint village of Carmel itself, and the drive through 17 Mile Drive and Pebble Beach (huge homes - like Palm Beach in many ways). Keep in mind that it is a 12-15 min drive from the resort back to CA 1 highway where you need to go to get anywhere.
reviews.title: Most Amazing Stay...
Design sharp resort, top cuisine, artisanal lavender and honey ranching too
reviews.text: After taking in the fun-though-crowded hubbub of Carmel-By-The-Sea to the west, or the rapturous, rawness of Big Sur to the south, winding through the quiet beauty of Carmel Valley gently soothes one into this ranch resort of the same name. The public areas and accommodations in this all-suite resort are sophisticated contemporary, while inviting at the same time, with ebony-toned, wide-plank floors, sheered, native stone fireplaces and firepits, and thoughtfully intriguing paintings, framed photos, and sculpture. Check-in is brief and convenient with one of the friendly and personable staft, at one of two desks with guest chairs. Close-in parking is available and once parked, one uses the resort transportaion (surreyed golf cart-type trolleys from suite to lodge and motor coaches to outlying attractions and Carmel-By-The-Sea). The pushbutton, natural stone gas fireplaces in the suites compliment the leather furniture, dark plank flooring (again), stone-topped endtables, and bronze-fixtured floor and table lighting. The basket of nutritious treats in the suites and the bottled water everywhere are complimentary. The bathrooms in the suites are generously sized and conveniently appointed, with water-preserving fixtures that are generous in force and delivery and proprietary toiletries that are lavender and other herbs-infused. The bedding is luxurious and the oversized, padded headboards and spot tasklighting make reading and watching the oversized flatscreen a dream, especially with the cozy throws and stackable pillows and bolsters.

reviews.title: Wow; what an amazingly wonderful place!
reviews.text: Besides the golf, spa, and swimming options that are routine at resorts, Carmel Valley Ranch also offers experiential offerings in honey, lavender essential oil, and lavender soap production in 60 to 90-minute small groups (depending on the class), with easygoing yet knowledgeable onsite boutique farmers John and Yoko (yes, really, and though they have heard every "Ballad of John and Yoko-type" reference hundreds of time before, they still laughingly take it all in stride, being the gentlefolk they are). Their "bee experience," which the resort really ought to amp up publicity on, is especially entertaining -- adults and children both love it, and fearful types do "get over it" when being suited up in protective, beekeeper gear. If time, regrettably, is too short for one of John and Yoko's classes, then even walking through the ranch lavender fields, which John designed and harvests, and vineyards is a treat.

reviews.title: Excellent two night stay
reviews.text: Farm-to-table dining is in store here, with even room service being impressive: after stoking the fireplace (i.e., simply turning it on) and nestling in under one of the throws, order up the roasted vegetable risotto entre and roasted artichoke starter, with its three equally rivaling dipping sauces.

reviews.title: The perfect escape!
reviews.text: A replenishing two days are good here, but three are ideal -- if only to try out the infinity view spa, and eat and rest some more. After check-out, 17-Mile Drive is easy access and is also en route to the user-friendly Monterey County Airport.

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights of a business trip and was overwhelmed with this place. The ranch is on a hill overlooking a vineyard and golf course, with gorgeous trees. The suites are lavish and very large. All have private porches, fireplaces, sunken tubs and all amenities. The food is wonderful, the pool is quiet and relaxing. The service was exceptional. I could go on and on.

reviews.title: Went for 1 night but had to stay for 2!
reviews.text: We had a reason to be in Monterrey on a Mon. morning and decided to make the night of it from SF. Over the years, we have come to Carmel many, many times and have probably stayed at almost every one of the Inn's and B & B's in the quaint town of Carmel By the Sea. We usually like staying downtown so that we could park once and then walk to the shops and galleries, the beach and dinner. Most often we paid exorbitant prices for nothing more than a dinky motel room caliber or B & B.

reviews.title: Relaxed, relaxed, relaxed
reviews.text: The weather is usually better in Carmel Valley and the atmosphere more laid back so we decided to go for it for this stay in chilly Nov. The moment we arrived at the Ranch, we realized that one night would just not be enough and extended it by another night.

reviews.title: Beautiful property, awesome options...
reviews.text: I have already, in other posts, sang the praises of the Joie De Vivre brand of boutique hotels as my new "fav" and this property sure did not let us down. Everything from the service to the rooms, to the location and the offerings (spa and restaurants) was just outstanding!!!

reviews.title: Perfect R and R
reviews.text: The staff was warm and friendly and quite solicitous. The grounds are well maintained and beautiful. Our huge suite was well appointed with plush towels, great linens and a comfortable bed. We could not get enough of the fireplaces and comfortable, high caliber decor.

reviews.title: Great place to relax
reviews.text: I had a wonderful massage and the dining room was GREAT for both dinner and breakfasts. So very relaxing!

reviews.title: A Pet Lover's Paradise and so much more...
reviews.text: A review long overdue but nevertheless. To call Carmel Valley Ranch a Pet Lover's Paradise is an understatement. If my chihuahuas had to rate the resort, I'm sure they would have given all four paws. After being couped up in a small manhattan apartment all winter long, what a joy it was to run free on the beautiful ranch. The entire resort was leash-free indoors and out with the exception of the restaurant which by all means completely understandable but get this, there are two round dining tables in the lobby lounge right outside the restaurant where the restaurant kindly accommodated us and our pooches. One of the best breakfasts I've ever had in a hotel, how much can toast, eggs, sausage, bacon and juice impress you ask? That's how good it was, and we're picky eaters, and that's just breakfast, lunch was good too. And to top it off, professional, friendly servers, great floor to ceiling views of the pool, dogs by my side, just perfect. The pet amenities in room were cute and the bag dispensers were super convenient. I'm not quite sure what more I would have asked for here, I've been to hotels where they give away pet toys and treats especially when there's an added fee so maybe a little memorabilia would have been nice since the dog bowls and mat was not ours to keep.

reviews.title: Super relax and unwind
reviews.text: The room was spacious, clean, tasteful and adequate. If you can afford the pricier room categories (Weekdays are usually a little slower and rates a little better) I think you'll get something that looks more like the beautiful shots on the website but hopefully you're not spending that much time in the room anyway! Enjoy the resort amenities, walk through the vineyard, checkout the organic garden and join the Bee Experience, that was pretty cool. Then drive 10 minutes out to Carmel-By-The-Sea and enjoy the quaint little town also known for their pet friendly beach and excellent dining options. Let's just say I don't expect much with food when we travel with our dogs because we're limited in choices but they were definitely good enough for the wannabe foodies that we are.

reviews.title: Puts the word 'treat' into 'retreat'
reviews.text: All in all, a beautiful resort tucked away in a peaceful valley but close enough to the beautiful city of Carmel in Monterey County. I don't usually think about going to the same place twice but a truly great destination for a 3-4 day vacation that I would think about taking again, this time perhaps with family.

reviews.title: Arrived frazzled, left peaceful.
reviews.text: Set in beuatifull surroundings, incl. Golfcourse, this ranch surprised us in the most positive way. Fantastic rooms, incl.nfireplace in the bedroom and relaxing terrace.

reviews.title: Beautiful romantic hideaway
reviews.text: Great food in welcome design at the restaurant. This all with super service.

description: Stunning and relaxing, our elegant Carmel resort is abundant with the natural beauty of Northern California, offering intuitive service and memorable experiences in a striking venue. Savor incomparable comfort, breathtaking vistas, and a delightful array of activities at Carmel Valley Ranch.
